Uses of Interface
org.bonitasoft.engine.identity.User

  • Packages that use User 
    Package Description
    org.bonitasoft.engine.api
    The Bonita project has a clear separation between the API the users should be interacting with and the actual implementation classes.
    org.bonitasoft.engine.identity
    Manages information about an organization, that is, the set of users who can act in processes and the groups and the organization's roles and the relation between them.

    • Uses of User in org.bonitasoft.engine.api

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User UserAPI.createUser(String userName, String password)
      Creates a user.
      User UserAPI.createUser(String userName, String password, String firstName, String lastName)
      Creates a user.
      User UserAPI.createUser(UserCreator creator)
      Creates a user.
      User UserAPI.getUser(long userId)
      Retrieves the user.
      User UserAPI.getUserByUserName(String userName)
      Retrieves the user.
      User UserAPI.updateUser(long userId, UserUpdater updater)
      Updates the user according to the updater values.
      Methods in org.bonitasoft.engine.api that return types with arguments of type User 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<User> UserAPI.getActiveUsersInGroup(long groupId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of active users in groups.
      List<User> UserAPI.getActiveUsersInRole(long roleId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of active users in role.
      List<User> UserAPI.getActiveUsersWithManager(long managerId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of active users of a manager.
      List<User> UserAPI.getInactiveUsersInGroup(long groupId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of inactive users in groups.
      List<User> UserAPI.getInactiveUsersInRole(long roleId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of inactive users in role.
      List<User> UserAPI.getInactiveUsersWithManager(long managerId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of inactive users of a manager.
      List<User> ProcessManagementAPI.getPossibleUsersOfHumanTask(long processDefinitionId, String humanTaskName, int startIndex, int maxResults)
      Lists the possible users (candidates) of the specified human task definition.
      List<User> ProcessRuntimeAPI.getPossibleUsersOfPendingHumanTask(long humanTaskInstanceId, int startIndex, int maxResults)
      Lists the possible users (candidates) of the specified human task instance.
      List<User> UserAPI.getUsers(int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of users.
      Map<Long,User> UserAPI.getUsers(List<Long> userIds)
      Retrieves the users.
      Map<String,User> UserAPI.getUsersByUsernames(List<String> userNames)
      Retrieves the identifiers of the named users.
      List<User> UserAPI.getUsersInGroup(long groupId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of users, both active and inactive, in a given group.
      List<User> UserAPI.getUsersInRole(long roleId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of users, regardless if they are active or not, in a given role.
      List<User> UserAPI.getUsersWithManager(long managerId, int startIndex, int maxResults, UserCriterion criterion)
      Retrieves the paginated list of users of a manager.
      SearchResult<User> UserAPI.searchUsers(SearchOptions options)
      Searches users according to the criteria containing in the options.
      SearchResult<User> ProcessRuntimeAPI.searchUsersWhoCanExecutePendingHumanTask(long humanTaskInstanceId, SearchOptions searchOptions)
      Lists the possible users (candidates) that can execute the specified human task instance.
      SearchResult<User> ProcessManagementAPI.searchUsersWhoCanStartProcessDefinition(long processDefinitionId, SearchOptions searchOptions)
      Searches for the number and the list of users who can start the process.
